title: Volvo XC90 long-term test review: is our favourite Swedish SUV still top of the class
text:
Volvo’s versatile, family all-rounder has a hard-earned reputation as one of the best SUVs available. Is the Swedish seven-seater still top of the class?

Our Car:Volvo XC90 D5 PowerPulse R-Design Pro Auto

List price when new: £58,735

Price as tested: £65,460 OTR

Official fuel economy: 47.3mpg

Read more long-term tests

April 17, 2019

Fuel economy this week: 33.8mpg

This is my second long-term Volvo in a year. The XC90 is big brother to the equally talented XC60 – and since I tested that model the smaller, multi-award-winning XC40 has come along too.

Sit behind the steering wheel of any XC and it’s easy to understand why sales have gone ballistic over the last 12 months. Volvo just can’t make...
description: Volvo’s versatile, family all-rounder has a hard-earned reputation as one of the best SUVs available.
